label: CT100 Plus
info_overview: The CT100 Plus is a sleek, modern thermostat design for home automation systems. It’s clean user interface compliments app-enabled systems. It features adjustable real-time alerts to enable cloud triggers, a robust data stream of HVAC information for cloud monitoring, and configurable comfort response settings to customize home control scenes. The CT100 Plus is compatible with all popular HVAC systems and is battery-operated without the need for a C-wire.
info_inclusion:
1.  From the CT100’s Menu screen, touch MATE under the radio icon. The Network Include screen displays a large r1.
  2. Touch MATE again. This initiates the network connection (mating) process. The MATE icon and the status indicator LEDs will blink.

When the CT100 has successfully joined a Z-Wave network, the MATE icon is replaced by the LINK icon under the radio tower.
info_exclusion:
1.  From the CT100’s Menu screen, touch MATE under the radio icon. The Network Include screen displays a large r1.
  2. Touch MATE again. This initiates the network connection (mating) process. The MATE icon and the status indicator LEDs will blink.

When you are trying to disconnect from (leave) a network, the LINK icon disappears when the node has successfully left the network.

parameters.label: Temperature Reporting Threshold
parameters.description: Reporting threshold for changes in the ambient temperature
parameters.overview: This value determines the reporting threshold when association reporting is enabled. Unsupported values will be ignored.

parameters.label: HVAC Settings
parameters.overview:
Byte 1 = HVAC Setup: Normal (0x01) or Heat Pump (0x02)
Byte 2 = Aux Setup (Gas (0x01) or Electric (0x02)) & Number of Auxiliary Stages (Heat Pump)/Number of Heat Stages (Normal)
Byte 3 = Number of Heat Pump Stages
Byte 4 = Number of Cool Stages

parameters.label: Utility Lock Enable/Disable
parameters.overview: If set to 0, the utility lock is disabled, all other values, 1-255, will enable the utility lock. This will prevent changes to the setpoint at the thermostat screen.

parameters.label: Power Status
parameters.overview: If 0x01, the thermostat is powered by a C-wire. If 0x02, the thermostat is powered by batteries.

parameters.label: Humidity Reporting Threshold
parameters.description: Reporting threshold for changes in the relative humidity
parameters.overview: This value determines the reporting threshold when association reporting is enabled. Unsupported values will be ignored.

parameters.label: Auxiliary/Emergency
parameters.description: Enables or disables auxiliary / emergency heating
parameters.overview: If set to 0, auxiliary / emergency heat is disabled, all other values, 1-255, will enable the auxiliary / emergency heat. This can only be enabled when the thermostat is set to Heat Pump mode.

parameters.label: Thermostat Swing Temperature
parameters.description: Variance allowed from setpoint to engage HVAC
parameters.overview: The thermostat swing temperature is in units of 0.5 degrees Fahrenheit.

parameters.label: Thermostat Diff Temperature
parameters.overview: Sets the differential temperature for multi-stage HVAC systems. The differential temperature delta defines when the thermostat will turn on additional stages. This command configures both the heat and cool differential temperatures.

parameters.label: Thermostat Recovery Mode
parameters.overview: The Thermostat Recovery Mode can be either fast (1) or economy (2).

parameters.label: Temperature Reporting Filter
parameters.description: Upper/Lower bounds for thermostat temperature reporting
parameters.overview: The thermostat will report ambient temperature changes for temperature values less than the lower bound. This field must be between 0F and 124F. By default, this value is 124F (report all temperature changes).

parameters.label: Simple UI Mode
parameters.overview: If the value is set to 0 then Normal Mode is enabled. If the value is set to 1 then Simple Mode is enabled.

parameters.label: Multicast
parameters.overview: If set to 0, Multicast is disabled. If set to 1, Multicast is enabled.

associations.label: Group 1
associations.description: Send report about Thermostat Mode, Thermostat Operating State, Fan Mode, Fan State, Setpoint, Sensor Multilevel

commandclass.name: NO_OPERATION
commandclass.label: No Operation - used for PINGing a device.
